comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Maybe I'm wrong but this seems like an easily manipulated contest by the casino. I think your marketing department needs to come up with something more creative vs trying to run a contest that the casino could manipulate to get deposits.I see you've ran the same competition in the past but noone from here is saying they won, just a crypt#### winner.

comments.author: 4CryptoBetNet
comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on March 24, 2023, 01:37:42 AMMaybe I'm wrong but this seems like an easily manipulated contest by the casino. I think your marketing department needs to come up with something more creative vs trying to run a contest that the casino could manipulate to get deposits.I see you've ran the same competition in the past but noone from here is saying they won, just a crypt#### winner. Thank you for sharing your concerns regarding our contests. We understand your apprehensions about the possibility of them being manipulated, but we can assure you that they are not. However, we acknowledge that there is no physical evidence to support our claim.Please be advised that we will not disclose any personal information about the winners, unless they choose to share it publicly. Our primary objective in organizing such competitions is not solely to encourage deposits, but to promote a particular cryptocurrency or highlight a feature that we believe our players would benefit from exploring.We appreciate your feedback and are constantly striving to offer more engaging and innovative promotions. Please stay tuned for exciting updates in this regard.

comments.author: 4CryptoBetNet
